item.title: Fixing ever-growing kern.log, messages and syslog files on Debian
item.description: After a Fresh install of Debian, I was suddenly surprised by the current lack of disk space to save a file. This post is a memo for my future self of how I managed to solve this issue. In summary, the lack of disk space was caused by ever-growing logging messages stored on three files located in /var/log: messages, kern.log, and syslog. What messages?
